original_solution_mapping.L3: So they each have to pay him 54,000/9=$<<54000/9=6000>>6,000 per year

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5977.
    Returns: the amount each parent has to pay per year.
    """
    # L1
    former_job_salary = 45000 # His former job paid 45,000 per year
    raise_percentage = 0.2 # offered him a 20% raise
    raise_amount = former_job_salary * raise_percentage

    # L2
    new_wage = former_job_salary + raise_amount

    # L3
    num_kids = 9 # 9 kids
    cost_per_parent = new_wage / num_kids

    # FA
    answer = cost_per_parent
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: So they each have to pay him {new_wage}/{num_kids}=${new_wage}/{num_kids}={cost_per_parent}>>{cost_per_parent} per year

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So they each have to pay him 90000/9=$90000/9=10000>>10000 per year

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'former_job_salary' (value: 45000) was used instead of 'raise_amount' (value: 9000.0).
